summary: This is an email chain between attorneys at Kobre & Kim LLP discussing Jeffrey Epstein's bail application and Judge Richard Berman's handling of the case. The emails critique the legal strategy in Epstein's bail letter, particularly the argument about private guards and equal protection, and speculate about Judge Berman's pre-formed opinion.

events.title: Email Discussion on Epstein Bail
events.description: Attorneys at Kobre & Kim LLP exchange emails analyzing Jeffrey Epstein's bail application letter and Judge Berman's likely denial.

events.title: Epstein's Bail Application Filing
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's defense team, led by Reid Weingarten, files a bail application arguing for private guards and offering to ground his private jet, which is critiqued in the emails.

events.title: Judge Berman Denies Extension
events.description: Judge Richard Berman denies a 24-hour extension requested by the government because Epstein delayed filing his financial disclosure, indicating he may have already decided the bail issue.

keyFacts: Epstein's defense attorney, Reid Weingarten, filed a bail letter arguing that not allowing a rich defendant to hire private guards and live in his mansion raises equal protection concerns based on socioeconomic status.
The bail letter also included an offer from Epstein to 'deregister or otherwise ground his private jet' as a condition of bail.
Judge Richard Berman denied a government request for a 24-hour extension to review Epstein's delayed financial disclosure, suggesting he had already made up his mind on bail.
Legal analysts in the email chain viewed the argument for private guards as a poor tactic that could annoy Judge Berman while he was being asked for 'extraordinary relief.'
